snippet.textDisplay: The greatest ending theme in video history and arguably one of the great gaming themes ever.  Still get goose bumps to this day.  What a rapturous end to an adventure that for me has yet to be surpassed in the JRPG market.
snippet.textOriginal: The greatest ending theme in video history and arguably one of the great gaming themes ever.  Still get goose bumps to this day.  What a rapturous end to an adventure that for me has yet to be surpassed in the JRPG market.

snippet.textDisplay:
Love this song.

Here the lyrics:

Latin

Caelum hume sitien taire
Vertus sahrel shamasantia
Ecce valde generous ale posselna volucritus
Sona areru ec paldeel?
Sona mi areru ec sancitu?
Ale posselna volucritus

Tenna prena posteri dire
Vertus narrel mea chorus
Aude valde generous sana fiare actertis
Sona areru ec paldeel?
Sona mi areru ec sancitu?
Sana fiare actertisia

English Translation

In the sky, the earth, and the beloved sea,
The Knower of Truth hath appeared
Look - The precious Winged One takes flight
Art thou the bringer of ruin?
Art thou the holy one?
The Winged One takes flight

I shall tell you the wishes of time,
I shall sing the tale of truth
Listen - That precious voice spins the everlasting story
Art thou the bringer of ruin?
Art thou the holy one?
That voice spins the everlasting story

snippet.textDisplay: I have 3 copies of this amazing game, 2 sealed. I worked Sesoanl at Toys R Us when I was 17 and read how few copies were made of it. I bought all 3 copies we received for 30 each. I'm never selling them. I don't want to sound biased since I'm not a big fan of RPG's. But this game, in my opinion is as close to "Perfect" as a game can get in my eyes. Sega needs to get their act together and Re-code this game and release it. They can salvage the audio, it's flawless. We need this with modern grafx.
snippet.textOriginal: I have 3 copies of this amazing game, 2 sealed. I worked Sesoanl at Toys R Us when I was 17 and read how few copies were made of it. I bought all 3 copies we received for 30 each. I'm never selling them. I don't want to sound biased since I'm not a big fan of RPG's. But this game, in my opinion is as close to "Perfect" as a game can get in my eyes. Sega needs to get their act together and Re-code this game and release it. They can salvage the audio, it's flawless. We need this with modern grafx.

snippet.textDisplay: The most serious JRPG ever created. PDS is perfect, there is not ONE thing out of place. It is a real shame so few people got to experience it... let's relish the thought that we were among the few that beheld the precious wings...

snippet.textDisplay: I only played Panzer Dragoon Orta, but from what I saw it was amazing. I loved the game and I wish I could play this one. Its soundtrack is just excellent all around. I can't believe how many people haven't even heard of this game before! A forgotten great.

snippet.textDisplay: I never owned this game, but I fell in love with this song after hearing it on the jukebox in the Phantasy Star Online III lobby. It ended up with me going on this insane quest of finding an MP3 of this song online, so that I could listen to it on my MP3 player. Ah, nostalgia!
snippet.textOriginal: I never owned this game, but I fell in love with this song after hearing it on the jukebox in the Phantasy Star Online III lobby. It ended up with me going on this insane quest of finding an MP3 of this song online, so that I could listen to it on my MP3 player. Ah, nostalgia!
